english: I will be in Tokyo next week, too.

answers.notes: Uses おる as the extra-modest expression for いる.

english: I will (modestly) go to the park where the company president (graciously) is.

answers.notes: Uses 参ります as the extra-modest expression for 行く and いらっしゃる as the honorific expression for いる.

english: I will go to Osaka by Shinkansen.

answers.notes: Uses 参る as the extra-modest expression for 行く.
Uses へ instead of に for the destination particle.

english: This product is on the first floor.

answers.notes: Uses ございます as the extra-modest expression for ある.
Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です.

english: I am writing a novel as a hobby.

answers.notes: Uses ～ておる as the extra-modest expression for ～ている.
Uses 執筆 (formal word for 'writing') with ～ておる.

english: I will continue this project next month, too.

answers.notes: Uses ～ておる as the extra-modest expression for ～ている.
Uses 進める (to advance) with ～ておる.

english: I went to the travel agency the other day.
hint: Use 先日 (せんじつ) instead of この間 for "'the other day" as it's more formal.

segments: 旅行会社[りょこうがいしゃ]
answers.notes: Uses 参る as the extra-modest expression for 行く.

segments: 旅行会社[りょこうがいしゃ]
answers.notes: Uses へ instead of に for the destination particle.

english: These sneakers are on the third floor.

answers.notes: Uses ございます as the extra-modest expression for ある.
Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です.

english: I will (modestly) go to the branch office tomorrow, where the manager (graciously) is.

answers.notes: Uses 参ります as the extra-modest expression for 行く and いらっしゃる as the honorific expression for いる.

english: I submitted my résumé last month.
hint: 提出する (ていしゅつする) is a formal verb for"submit" (for documents, reports, etc.).

answers.notes: Uses いたす as the extra-modest expression for する.

segments: お 出[だ]しいたしました
answers.notes: Uses お出しいたす (extra-modest + humble in one).

english: I am painting as a hobby.

answers.notes: Uses ～ておる as the extra-modest expression for ～ている.
Uses 制作 (formal word for 'creating') with ～ておる.
Uses ございます as the extra-modest expression for ある. "とても" to keep things simple.
Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です. "とても" to keep things simple.
Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です. '非常に' is a more formal and refined adverb meaning 'extremely,' appropriate for polite contexts.
Uses ございます as the extra-modest expression for ある. '非常に' is a formal adverb meaning 'extremely,' suitable for polite speech.

english: I will go to Kyoto by Shinkansen next week, too.

answers.notes: Uses 参る as the extra-modest expression for 行く.
Uses へ instead of に for the destination particle.

english: I went to the branch office the other day.
hint: Use 先日 (せんじつ) instead of この間 for "'the other day" as it's more formal.

answers.notes: Uses 参る as the extra-modest expression for 行く.
Uses へ instead of に for the destination particle.

english: This branch is scheduled to close next month.
hint: Use 閉店する (へいてんする) for permanent closures, such as stores, branches, etc.

answers.notes: Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です.
Adds で before 閉店 for emphasis (で meaning by/at next month).

english: I have recently been taking photos as a hobby.

answers.notes: Uses ～ておる as the extra-modest expression for ～ている.
Uses 撮影 (formal word for 'taking photos') with ～ておる.

english: I will do this work next week, too.

answers.notes: Uses いたす as the extra-modest expression for する.

english: This fan is very mysterious, isn't it?

answers.notes: Uses でございます as the extra-modest replacement for です.
Uses 非常に instead of とても for 'very.'

english: I will participate in this project next month, too.

answers.notes: Uses いたす as the extra-modest expression for する.
